alert.note: Alert for Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 10:44PM CDT until October 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in San Angelo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Llano River Near Mason affecting Mason County. For the Llano River...including Mason...Minor flooding is forecast. The river is expected to fall below flood stage by mid Friday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Llano River near Mason. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur. Secondary roads and low water crossings will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 17.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will rise to flood stage. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on 11/15/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecast (11 pm) Information Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Llano River Mason 18.0 16.7 Thu 10 pm CDT 10.7 8.3 7.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1045 AM CDT.
